steps: Wash your hands with soap and water before touching the wound.
Rinse the wound with clean, running water to remove dirt and debris.
Apply gentle pressure with a clean cloth or bandage to stop any bleeding.
Apply an antiseptic cream or ointment.
Cover the wound with a sterile bandage to keep it clean and prevent infection.
first_aid.source_name: American Red Cross; various health ministries

steps: Immediately cool the burn by holding it under cool, running water for 15-20 minutes.
Do NOT use ice, butter, or toothpaste, as this can cause further damage.
Gently cover the burn with a sterile, non-adhesive bandage or a clean cloth.
Take over-the-counter pain medication if needed.
first_aid.warning: Seek immediate medical help for severe burns (blistered, charred skin, or large area).
